content.title: Family Pension (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Family Pension' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, on the death of a pensioner worker who is being given pension by the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, half of his/her pension is given to his/her spouse (as the case may be).
benefits: After the death of the worker-pensioner, half of the pension amount will be given to the dependent wife/husband as family pension every month.
eligibility: The applicant should be the spouse of the deceased worker.
The deceased worker should have been registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered deceased worker must have been getting the pension from the Board.
documents_required: Identity card of the registered deceased worker

faqs.question: Who administers this scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Family Pension' scheme is administered by the Labour Department, Government of Haryana, through the HBOCWWB.

faqs.question: What happens to the pension of a deceased worker under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Upon the death of a pensioner worker registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, half of their pension is provided to their spouse.

faqs.question: How is the pension distributed to the spouse?
faqs.answer: Half of the pension amount is given to the dependent wife or husband of the deceased worker as family pension on a monthly basis.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to receive benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The spouse of the deceased worker is eligible to receive benefits under the 'Family Pension' scheme.

faqs.question: What are the requirements for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be the spouse of the deceased worker who was registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: Does the deceased worker need to be receiving pension for eligibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, the registered deceased worker must have been receiving pension from the Board.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the 'Family Pension' scheme?
faqs.answer: To apply for the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
